metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2833 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 47.0 ignores Content Security Policy (CSP)directives for cross-domain Java applets, which makes it easier for remoteattackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via a craftedapplet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2833` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
